reason.description: The basic architecture of the internal DTD parser can not handle invalid usage of parameter entities.
WFC Constraint for standalone='yes' is not implemented yet.

Laxity of VC Constraint regarding not declared entities is not implemented yet. The XmlML parser requires always that a named entity is declared in any case (except of the pre defined entities lt, amp, gt, quot and apos).
This test case is related of missplaced BOMs. As XSLT is not able to work on binary level, the parser depends on the implementation of the unparsed-text() function here.

The test contains a combination of characters which is interpreted by the unparsed-text() function as a single character. The character comibnation is a well-formed element name since XML Edition 5, but the single character not.
There is a bug in Saxon-HE which causes that Saxon throws an uncatchable exception when it tries to read the non-wellformed file using unparsed-text() function and terminates any process.
The test case rules only for one of the earlier editions than the fifth of the XML 1.0 recommendation.
The test case rules only for the XML version 1.1. The XmlML parser supports XML 1.0 only.
